p: The WHO Regional Office for the Eastern Mediterranean has been collaborating with the Influenza Division of International Program of the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) since 2006 to enhance influenza surveillance in the Region. The goal of this collaboration has been to enable the 22 countries of the Region to collect good quality surveillance data on influenza and influenza-associated illnesses in a timely and reliable manner, use these data to improve understanding of the burden, seasonality and risk factors of influenza in the Region, and use such evidence to introduce control measures such as influenza vaccines to reduce the incidence of severe disease and death attributed to influenza. This successful collaboration has led to substantial improvements in influenza surveillance in the Region and the use of data for public health [ 3].
